articles.author: Steven Lee Myers and Lam Yik Fei
articles.title: In Macau, China Sees a Model for a Rebellious Hong Kong
articles.description: The former Portuguese colony, now a global gambling hub, has been more willing than its neighbor to accept Beijing’s authority.
articles.content:
On the mainland, the anniversary has occasioned tributes to Macaus transformation under one country, two systems. The state television network, CCTV, broadcast a series of glowing documentaries. Air Chinas in-flight magazine devoted 50 pages to it.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Hitachi to Sell Chemical Unit, Medical Equipment Business for $6 Billion - The New York Times
articles.description: Japan's Hitachi Ltd said on Wednesday it would sell its listed chemicals unit and diagnostic imaging business in a deal totalling 673 billion yen (£4.8 billion), as the Japanese industrial conglomerate overhauls its business portfolio.
articles.content:
Hitachi's diagnostic imaging business will be sold to Fujifilm Holdings Corp for 179 billion yen as the Japanese photocopier and camera manufacturer deepens its push into healthcare.
The deal follows a recent series of acquisitions by Fujifilm, including a d… [+715 chars]

articles.author: Jack Ewing and Liz Alderman
articles.title: Fiat Chrysler and Peugeot Agree on Terms to Forge New Auto Giant
articles.description: The formal accord, after a preliminary deal in October, still requires months of work to integrate the automakers.
articles.content:
Fiat Chrysler and PSA of France said Wednesday that they had agreed to the terms of a merger that would create the worlds fourth largest automaker.
The companies said they had signed a binding agreement formalizing the merger, announced in October.
